meanings.definition: Thermosets: materials that undergo a chemical reaction when heated and become permanently set.
meanings.sent1: The thermosets used in the construction industry are known for their durability.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers prefer thermosets for their ability to maintain their shape under high temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The thermosets at the factory decided to stick together and form a strong bond.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like thermosets, unyielding and unchangeable.
meanings.sent5: The artist molded the thermosets into a beautiful sculpture that would last for centuries.

meanings.definition: Thermosets: a type of polymer that becomes rigid and non-melting when heated.
meanings.sent1: The thermosets used in the car industry ensure the vehicles remain sturdy.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the scientist observed how thermosets retained their shape even under extreme heat.
meanings.sent3: The thermosets in the lab decided to have a dance party and never melted on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: His principles were as solid as thermosets, never bending to outside pressure.
meanings.sent5: The chef used thermosets to create a heat-resistant coating for the cookware.
